page.title: 15FARMING
page.content: The area lies on the coastal plain sheltered in the north by the South Downs and to the south by the Selsey Peninsula. The land is flat, composed mainly of clay with an abundance of flints littering the surface. Surrounding the small rural villages is land used for farming. The main crop grown in this area is wheat, other crops include potatoes, rape, peas, barley. A small portion is grassland which supplies Friesian cattle with pasture land. The old aerodrome at Tangmere is being demolished and the runways torn up. The land has been returned to the farmers. The main buildings area having been bought by a Private developer. In 1985/86/87 the following changes are planned for the village. Some 37 acres on the airfield will be (cont.)
